channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: Former gravel pits searched in missing chef case
item.description: Police search an area outside York for traces of the missing chef, who disappeared in March 2009.

item.title: Covid: Cornwall tourists urged to 'stay away' as cases rise
item.description: Visit Cornwall says only people who have booked should visit as cases nearly double in a week.

item.title: Lee Peacock: Reward offered in hunt for man over killings
item.description: Police are searching for 49-year-old Lee Peacock over the deaths of two people in Westminster.

item.title: 'Fascist' teenager from Essex had 3D-printed gun plan
item.description: Matthew Cronjager wanted to bring about a "revolution" based on his racist ideology, a court hears.

item.title: Two-year-old dies in fire at Ingoldmells caravan park
item.description: The child's mother and three siblings escaped the blaze in Ingoldmells, Lincolnshire Police say.

item.title: M25: Three dead and two arrested after lorry, minibus and car crash
item.description: A fourth person is in hospital after the crash involving a lorry, minibus and car near Waltham Abbey.

item.title: 'Tom Cruise is in my Warwickshire garden'
item.description: A request to land a helicopter carrying an unnamed VIP leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion: Giant table erected in London street dismantled
item.description: Police took apart the structure on Tuesday morning, as more protests take place in Whitehall.

item.title: Help needed to identify woman found dead in Oxfordshire lake
item.description: Police say there have been no missing person reports matching her description.

item.title: Election hopeful Thom Campion apologises for sexist, abusive rants
item.description: Lib Dem candidate Thom Campion says the hate-filled posts "did not reflect" his views today.

item.title: Man jailed after Â£1.7m of heroin found in car
item.description: A London drug dealer was pulled over by police who found a holdall full of drugs on the back seat.

item.title: River Wharfe at Ilkley: Samples fail to hit safety standards
item.description: Up to 1,750 people swim in the River Wharfe at Ilkley on the warmest days, a community group says.

item.title: How the world's oldest hat shop made it through lockdown
item.description: Lock & Co was first established in 1676 and has sold hats to the likes of Nelson and Winston Churchill.

item.title: Mission: Impossible train crashes into quarry in Stoney Middleton
item.description: Local photographers said the film's star Tom Cruise had been at the quarry to witness the crash.

item.title: Solihull friends' lockdown boredom turns horse box into pizzeria
item.description: Enterprising teenagers oversee the conversion to launch a mobile food business.

item.title: Ferrybridge chimney stacks demolished in controlled explosion
item.description: The controlled explosion takes place at a former coal-fired power station in West Yorkshire.

item.title: 'Race should not be a factor in my destiny'
item.description: A young Londoner beats 23,000 other entrants in one of the country's largest anti-racism competitions.

item.title: Toxic mix of chemicals at Solent Hotel leaves 24 in hospital
item.description: Hotel guests were overcome by fumes in the spa area and some required ventilation, say firefighters.

item.title: Three people rescued from Chesterfield building collapse
item.description: A neighbour said it was a "miracle" nobody was killed after a portable gas canister exploded

item.title: Warrington drug dealer caught out by seat belt check
item.description: Police checking if Michael Sherwood was wearing a seat belt found drugs, cash and phones in his car.

item.title: Man bailed after Katie Price assault arrest
item.description: The man, 32, was arrested on suspicion of assault, theft and coercive and controlling behaviour.

item.title: Goat missing and ewes found dead after farm theft
item.description: Baby goat Matilda is missing and two sheep were stolen then found dead outside the family farm park.

item.title: Woman who saved drowning boy in Bournemouth 'expected the worst'
item.description: The mum spotted the young child lying motionless in shallow water, unnoticed by fellow beachgoers.

item.title: JMW Turner painting goes on display for first time since 1833
item.description: It is part of a series of artworks being shown in an attempt to entice people back to small museums.

item.title: Norwich man flies paramotor down UK for Alzheimer's research
item.description: Daniel Jones lands in Cornwall to complete an Alzheimer's challenge in tribute to his grandparents.

item.title: Premier League clubs will not release players for international games in red-list countries
item.description: The Premier League says its clubs have "reluctantly but unanimously" decided not to release players for matches in red-list countries during September's international break.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 2020 Games get under way with powerful opening ceremony
item.description: The Tokyo 2020 Paralympics are officially under way after a powerful opening ceremony.

item.title: England v India: Virat Kohli says hosts 'provoked' his side at Lord's
item.description: Captain Virat Kohli says his India side will "not take a backwards step" when they meet England in the third Test at Emerald Headingley on Wednesday.
